Entities.Name: Heart Disease Risk Factors
Entities.Definition: Factors identified as contributing to heart disease, categorized into risks such as hyperlipidemia, hypertension, obesity, smoking status, diabetes, and medications like metoprolol.

Sample Data.Sentence: Identification of heart disease risk factors such as hyperlipidemia, hypertension, obesity, and smoking status is crucial for early intervention.
Sample Data.Annotated: Risk Factors: hyperlipidemia, hypertension, obesity, smoking status

Entities.Name: Medications
Entities.Definition: Medications related to the management or risk factor modification of heart disease.

Sample Data.Sentence: Common medications for managing heart disease include metoprolol.

Dataset.Name: i2b2 Challenge Data
Dataset.Details: Data consists of longitudinal medical records from 300 patients, annotated for various heart disease risk factors to support the development of NLP systems.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: The document outlines the annotation guidelines used for tagging clinical texts with heart disease risk factors, including detailed descriptions of risk categories and associated medications.
Annotation Guidelines.Link: Detailed annotation guidelines can be referred to in the i2b2 challenge documentation.
